sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: ACHR or EVEX: Which eVTOL Stock Offers Greater Upside?
feed.summary: This article compares Archer Aviation (ACHR) and Eve Holding (EVEX), two eVTOL companies, evaluating their potential upside for investors. While both are positioned to benefit from the growing urban air mobility market, Archer Aviation is highlighted as having a stronger investment case due to its regulatory readiness, international expansion, strategic partnerships, improving earnings outlook, and more attractive valuation. Eve Holding is noted for technical progress and supply-chain partnerships, but with a weaker earnings outlook and less attractive valuation.

feed.title: Eve completes first flight of full-scale eVTOL prototype By Investing.com
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility (NYSE:EVEX) successfully conducted the first flight of its uncrewed full-scale electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) prototype. This milestone, achieved at Embraer's test facility in Brazil, validates critical system integration and positions Eve for further flight testing throughout 2026, aiming for type certification and market entry by 2027. The company's stock has shown recent strong momentum, and it continues to advance its development and obtain regulatory approvals with a significant backlog of 2,800 eVTOL aircraft.

feed.title: Eve Air Mobility Completes Successful First Flight of Full-Scale eVTOL Prototype
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility (NYSE: EVEX, EVEXW; B3: EVEB31) successfully completed the first flight of its uncrewed full-scale eVTOL prototype at Embraer's test facility in Gavião Peixoto, Brazil. This inaugural flight marks a significant milestone, validating the aircraft’s architecture, fly-by-wire controls, and integrated propulsion system, and initiates Eve's flight test phase. The company plans hundreds of flights throughout 2026 to gather data for certification and aims for type certification, first deliveries, and entry into service in 2027.

feed.title: Eve Air Mobility Completes Successful First Flight of Full-Scale eVTOL Prototype
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility (NYSE: EVEX, EVEXW; B3: EVEB31) successfully completed the first flight of its uncrewed full-scale eVTOL prototype at Embraer's test facility in Brazil. This milestone validates the aircraft's architecture, fly-by-wire controls, and integrated propulsion, marking a significant step towards urban air mobility certification. The company plans hundreds of additional flights in 2026 to expand the flight envelope and aims for type certification, first deliveries, and entry into service in 2027.

feed.title: EVE (NYSE:EVEX) Shares Gap Up - Here's Why
feed.summary: EVE (NYSE:EVEX) stock gapped up premarket from $4.83 to $5.07, although it traded down to $4.7710 intraday. The company has a consensus "Hold" rating from analysts with an average target price of $6.47, despite mixed analyst actions including a JPMorgan price target cut and a Canaccord Genuity increase. Institutional investors like Vanguard Group significantly increased their holdings in Q3, indicating continued interest in the sustainable urban air mobility solutions provider.

feed.title: Eve completes first flight of full-scale eVTOL prototype
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility, a subsidiary of Embraer, successfully conducted the first uncrewed flight of its full-scale electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) prototype in Brazil, marking a significant step towards certification and commercial launch in 2027. The flight validated critical system integration and gathered high-fidelity data, with plans for more extensive testing and six conforming prototypes. Eve (NYSE: EVEX) currently holds a backlog of 2,800 eVTOL aircraft and has received analyst coverage from Goldman Sachs and Cantor Fitzgerald.

feed.title: Eve Air Mobility Completes Successful First Flight of Full-Scale eVTOL Prototype
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility has successfully completed the first flight of its uncrewed full-scale eVTOL prototype, marking a significant milestone in validating its aircraft architecture and fly-by-wire controls. The company plans hundreds of flight tests in 2026 to gather data for certification and expects type certification, first deliveries, and entry into service by 2027. This achievement validates the program's path toward delivering a reliable, efficient, and simple solution for the Urban Air Mobility market.

feed.title: Electric vertical-takeoff prototype makes first flight in Brazil
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility (EVEX) successfully conducted the first flight of its uncrewed full-scale eVTOL prototype at Embraer's test facility in Brazil. This milestone validates the aircraft's architecture, fly-by-wire controls, and fixed-pitch lifter rotors, initiating a comprehensive flight test campaign. The company plans to build six conforming prototypes and conduct hundreds of flights in 2026, targeting type certification and initial deliveries in 2027 while engaging with regulatory bodies like ANAC, FAA, and EASA.

feed.title: Eve Air Mobility Completes Successful First Flight of Full-Scale eVTOL Prototype
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility successfully completed the first flight of its uncrewed full-scale eVTOL prototype, marking a significant step in validating its aircraft architecture and fly-by-wire controls. This event kicks off Eve's flight test phase, with hundreds of flights planned for 2026 to gather data for certification. The company anticipates type certification, first deliveries, and entry into service for its eVTOL aircraft by 2027.

feed.title: Eve Holding, Inc. (NYSE:EVEX) Receives Average Recommendation of "Hold" from Brokerages
feed.summary: Eve Holding, Inc. (NYSE:EVEX) has received a consensus "Hold" rating from eight brokerages, with an average 12-month price target of $6.468. Recent analyst actions, including a reiterated sell, a lowered price target with an overweight rating, a neutral initiation, and a boosted price target with a buy rating, reflect mixed sentiments. The stock opened at $4.63 with a $1.61 billion market cap and a negative P/E, having slightly beaten last quarter's EPS estimate.

feed.title: Cantor Fitzgerald Remains a Buy on Eve Holding (EVEX)
feed.summary: Cantor Fitzgerald reiterated a Buy rating on Eve Holding (EVEX) following the company's $1 billion deal with Beta Technologies for motors. This deal is expected to benefit Eve Holding's aircraft development, providing high power-to-weight ratio motors for its eVTOL aircraft. Analysts are optimistic about EVEX's potential, anticipating a 44.3% upside despite the company being in its pre-revenue stage, with first flight tests aimed for late 2025 or early 2026.

feed.title: 11 Best Aerospace Stocks to Buy According to Analysts
feed.summary: This article, part of a larger list, highlights Eve Holding, Inc. (NYSE: EVEX) as one of the best aerospace stocks to buy, according to analysts. Cantor Fitzgerald reiterated a Buy rating on EVEX after the company announced a $1 billion deal to acquire motors from Beta Technologies, which analysts believe will significantly benefit Eve Holding's aircraft development. Despite being in its pre-revenue stage, EVEX has a 12-month average price target suggesting over 44.3% upside, with first flights aimed for late 2025 or early 2026.

feed.title: Eve Holding stock rises as Cantor Fitzgerald reiterates Overweight rating By Investing.com
feed.summary: Eve Holding Inc. (NYSE:EVEX) saw its stock rise after Cantor Fitzgerald reiterated an Overweight rating, following the company's announcement of a partnership with BETA Technologies for eVTOL motor supply. This collaboration, expected to generate up to $1 billion in revenue for BETA over 10 years, strengthens Eve's aircraft development towards a projected first test flight in late 2025 or early 2026. Despite a recent gain of 8.28%, Eve Holding's stock is down over the past six months and is considered overvalued based on its current market capitalization.

feed.title: Eve Holding (EVEX) Is Up 29.9% After Securing Long-Term eVTOL Motor Deal With BETA Technologies
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility announced a long-term agreement with BETA Technologies for the supply of electric pusher motors for its eVTOL aircraft, supporting a backlog of 2,800 vehicles and a potential US$1.00 billion supply opportunity. This deal strengthens Eve's propulsion supply chain and indicates progress towards commercial service, impacting its investment narrative by making its large order book look more executable. While the share price has risen, investors must consider Eve's current zero-revenue, high-cash-burn phase and reliance on external funding.

feed.title: Eve Air Mobility Taps BETA For Key eVTOL Motors As First Flight Nears
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility has selected BETA Technologies to supply electric pusher motors for its eVTOL aircraft prototypes and future production models, following months of testing. The agreement is a potential 10-year deal worth up to $1 billion for BETA, with Eve expecting a debut flight in late 2025 or early 2026 for its 2,800-unit backlog. This collaboration will support Eve's cruise propulsion and propulsion architecture development.

feed.title: Eve Air Mobility (NYSE: EVEX) taps BETA in 10-year, $1B pusher motor deal
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility (NYSE: EVEX) has selected BETA Technologies (NYSE: BETA) to supply electric pusher motors for its eVTOL aircraft, solidifying a potential 10-year, $1 billion agreement. This collaboration strengthens Eve's supply chain for its 2,800 eVTOL backlog and follows successful validation of BETA's motor technology in Eve's engineering prototype. The partnership aims to enhance performance, safety, and supply-chain resilience as both companies move towards production and commercialization.

feed.title: Eve Holding stock jumps after selecting BETA for electric motors
feed.summary: Eve Holding Inc (EVEX) stock surged 14.8% and BETA Technologies Inc (BETA) shares rose 9.5% after Eve chose BETA to supply electric pusher motors for its conforming prototypes and production aircraft, a potential $1 billion opportunity over 10 years. This collaboration strengthens Eve's supply chain for its eVTOL aircraft, which has a backlog of 2,800 units. The first flight of Eve's prototype is anticipated between late 2024 and early 2026.

feed.title: Goldman Sachs initiates Eve Holding stock with Neutral rating
feed.summary: Goldman Sachs has initiated coverage on Eve Holding Inc. (NYSE:EVEX) with a Neutral rating and a price target of $4.84, citing concerns about the company's lack of flight tests and slow FAA certification timeline. Despite these concerns, Eve's strategic relationship with Embraer and focus on the Brazilian market offer advantages. The company recently reported a net loss of $47 million for Q3 2025 but secured credit lines from Brazil's National Development Bank for eVTOL aircraft motor development.

feed.title: 278,103 Shares in Eve Holding, Inc. $EVEX Acquired by Sagil Capital LLP
feed.summary: Sagil Capital LLP has acquired a new position of 278,103 shares in Eve Holding, Inc. (NYSE:EVEX) during the second quarter, valued at approximately $1.91 million. This acquisition represents about 0.8% of Sagil's portfolio and grants them approximately 0.09% ownership of EVE. The article also provides a company overview, recent stock performance, analyst ratings, and details on other institutional investments in Eve Holding.

feed.title: Eve Holding stock rating reiterated at Overweight by Cantor Fitzgerald
feed.summary: Cantor Fitzgerald has reiterated its Overweight rating and $7.00 price target for Eve Holding Inc. (NYSE:EVEX), citing the company's large customer pipeline and its strategic relationship with Embraer. The firm highlights Eve's financial stability, access to Embraer's manufacturing expertise, and a differentiated business model that includes services and maintenance. Additionally, Eve Holding recently secured significant financing from Brazil's National Development Bank for eVTOL aircraft motor development.

feed.title: This is Why Eve Holding Inc. (EVEX) is a Buy Despite Wider Than Expected Q3 Net Loss
feed.summary: Eve Holding Inc. (EVEX) is considered a "must-buy" due to significant progress in the eVTOL market and strong analyst ratings. Despite a wider-than-expected Q3 net loss attributed to increased R&D expenses for engineering engagement with Embraer and facility expansion, the company maintains a positive outlook. This outlook is supported by an expanding customer base, substantial order pipeline, and secured funding through 2027.

feed.title: Eve Holding, Inc. (NYSE:EVEX) Given Consensus Rating of "Hold" by Analysts
feed.summary: Seven analysts have assigned Eve Holding, Inc. (NYSE: EVEX) a consensus "Hold" rating, with an average one-year price target of $6.875. The stock opened at $3.87, has a market cap of $1.35 billion, and a negative P/E of -5.96. The company recently reported an EPS of -$0.14, beating estimates by $0.01.

feed.title: This is Why Eve Holding Inc. (EVEX) is a Buy Despite Wider Than Expected Q3 Net Loss
feed.summary: Eve Holding Inc. (NYSE: EVEX) is considered a "must-buy" despite a wider-than-expected Q3 net loss, largely due to increased R&D expenses. Analysts from H.C. Wainwright and Cannacord Genuity have reiterated Buy ratings, impressed by the company's progress in the eVTOL market and expanding facilities. Eve Holding also boasts a positive outlook with secured funding, an expanding customer base, and a significant pipeline of orders.

feed.title: Eve Holding (NYSE: EVEX) posts Q3 2025 liquidity of $534.3M, highlights cash runway
feed.summary: Eve Holding (NYSE: EVEX) reported a net loss of $46.9 million in Q3 2025, driven by increased R&D spending. Despite the loss, the company boasts a strong liquidity of $534.3 million, including $411.7 million in cash and investments, which implies a cash runway of over two years. This enhanced liquidity follows a successful $230 million equity placement in August 2025 from key investors like BNDES and Embraer, securing funding through 2027.

feed.title: Eve Holding, Inc. (NYSE:EVEX) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Eve Holding, Inc. reported its Q3 2025 earnings, beating EPS expectations. The company is in the final stages of testing its engineering prototype for its eVTOL aircraft, with the first flight expected by year-end 2025 or early 2026, aiming for Type certification and entry into service in 2027. Eve Holding announced Embraer as the 22nd primary system supplier for the landing gear, and secured a $230 million funding round, extending its cash runway through 2027.

feed.title: Eve Holding, Inc. Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
feed.summary: Eve Holding, Inc. (NYSE: EVEX) reported a net loss of $46.9 million in Q3 2025 due to increased Research & Development expenses for its eVTOL aircraft and UAM ecosystem development. Despite this, the company achieved its highest cash level since its 2022 IPO, totaling $411.7 million, with total liquidity reaching $534.3 million after a successful $230 million equity placement. This funding secures its development program through 2027 and provides a cash runway of over two years.

feed.title: EVEX Stock Price and Chart — NYSE:EVEX
feed.summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of Eve Holding, Inc. (EVEX) stock, including its current price, historical performance, key financial statistics, and upcoming earnings dates. It also features analyst ratings, ideas from traders, and information on related ETFs. The company's profile and frequently asked questions about its stock performance are also included.

feed.title: Eve Holding Signs Agreement with Embraer for eVTOL Support
feed.summary: Eve Holding, through its subsidiary Eve UAM, LLC, has signed a Master Services Agreement with Embraer S.A. to receive support services for developing an industrialization project for eVTOLs. This agreement, effective from January 1, 2025, aims to enhance production processes and plant operations at Eve's facility in Taubaté, Brazil. Despite facing financial challenges, Eve Holding is progressing with prototype development and has a robust order backlog, with analysts maintaining a Buy rating on EVEX stock.

feed.title: Eve Holding stock price target raised to $7.50 from $6.75 at Canaccord Genuity - Investing.com
feed.summary: Canaccord Genuity has increased its price target for Eve Holding Inc. to $7.50 from $6.75. This adjustment indicates an updated outlook from the analytical firm regarding the company's stock performance.

feed.title: Eve Air Mobility and InvestSP hold summit to accelerate regulation and infrastructure for eVTOL flights in Brazil - MarketScreener
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility and InvestSP held a summit in São Paulo to advance the regulation and infrastructure needed for eVTOL flights in Brazil, aiming for commercial operations by 2027. The discussions covered essential topics such as regulatory frameworks, the deployment of vertiports and charging stations, and workforce training for the Urban Air Mobility (UAM) sector. Eve Air Mobility plans to produce its eVTOLs in Taubaté, São Paulo, with a capacity of 480 units per year, projecting significant reductions in travel times and broader urban applications for the technology.

feed.title: 2,800 orders (~$14B) — Eve Air Mobility holds São Paulo summit to fast‑track 2027 eVTOL ops, vertiports - Stock Titan
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility and InvestSP held a summit in São Paulo to align regulation, infrastructure, and workforce training for commercial eVTOL operations targeting 2027 in Brazil. The company announced a production facility in Taubaté with a capacity of 480 units per year and approximately 2,800 global orders valued at $14 billion. The summit emphasized public-private coordination to ensure safe urban air mobility deployment.

feed.title: Cantor Fitzgerald reiterates Overweight rating on Eve Holding stock By Investing.com - Investing.com Canada
feed.summary: This article reports that Cantor Fitzgerald has reiterated its Overweight rating on Eve Holding stock. The content, however, indicates an application error, preventing the full details of the analyst's report from being displayed. Due to the error, no further information regarding the reiteration or the company is available.

feed.title: Cantor Fitzgerald reiterates Overweight rating on Eve Holding stock - Investing.com
feed.summary: This article indicates that Cantor Fitzgerald has reiterated an Overweight rating on Eve Holding stock. However, an application error prevented the display of the full content of the analyst report.

feed.title: Financial Comparison: Conrad Industries (OTCMKTS:CNRD) versus EVE (NYSE:EVEX)
feed.summary: This article provides a financial comparison between Conrad Industries (OTCMKTS:CNRD) and EVE (NYSE:EVEX), analyzing their risk and volatility, profitability, analyst ratings, valuation and earnings, and institutional & insider ownership. Conrad Industries is shown to outperform EVE on 7 out of 13 factors, offering higher revenue and earnings, and trading at a lower price-to-earnings ratio. EVE, however, receives a stronger consensus rating from analysts with a higher potential upside.

feed.title: Will New Funding and Backlog Growth Change Eve Holding's (EVEX) Urban Air Mobility Narrative? - Yahoo
feed.summary: Eve Holding (EVEX) recently raised $230 million and reported an expanding backlog of Letters of Intent for its eVTOL aircraft, bolstering its financial position and signaling strong commercial interest in urban air mobility. This capital injection aims to mitigate prior funding concerns and advance development, although the company still faces risks like a high price-to-book multiple and increased share dilution despite zero revenue and widening losses. The investment narrative hinges on the transition of eVTOLs from concept to commercial reality, with the new funds improving financial flexibility for the certification and manufacturing phases.

feed.title: Eve Holding enters agreement with Embraer for eVTOL manufacturing support
feed.summary: Eve Holding Inc. announced a Master Services Agreement with Embraer S.A. for support in developing an industrialization project for electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft (eVTOLs). Embraer will provide manufacturing processes and plant operation procedures for Eve's facility in Taubaté, Brazil. This agreement follows Eve Holding's recent Q2 2025 net loss, a successful $230 million capital raise, and adjusted analyst ratings from Canaccord Genuity and BTIG.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Eve Holding reports Q2 2025 loss, stock dips pre-market
feed.summary: Eve Holding Inc. (EVEX) reported a net loss for Q2 2025, with an EPS of -0.21, missing analyst expectations of -0.164, leading to a 3.43% pre-market stock dip. The company announced a Q2 net loss of $64 million due to significant R&D investments but highlighted a strong liquidity position of $375 million and an order backlog of approximately $14 billion. Eve Holding continues development of its eVTOL, aiming for TAP certification and service entry by 2027, with prototype flights expected in late 2025.

feed.title: Eve Air Mobility Ramps Up eVTOL Investment: Q2 R&D Spending Jumps 26% as First Prototype Takes Shape
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility reported a widened net loss of $64.7 million in Q2 2025, up from $36.4 million in Q2 2024, primarily due to a 25.9% increase in R&D expenses to $45.7 million for eVTOL development and prototype assembly. Despite higher cash consumption ($56.9 million), the company maintains strong liquidity of $375.5 million, which it expects to fund operations through 2026. Eve's workforce grew to 180 employees as it continues to advance its eVTOL aircraft development.

feed.title: Eve Holding: Paving The Way For Certification In 2027; Strong Liquidity Runway (NYSE:EVEX)
feed.summary: Eve Holding (EVEX) is positioned as a speculative buy, backed by Embraer, focusing on eVTOLs and related services with sufficient liquidity through 2026. The company targets certification by 2027 but may require additional capital for production ramp-up. Despite risks like high capital needs, its strong backing and diverse revenue streams offer long-term potential, with the stock currently considered fairly valued at a $3.36 price target.

feed.title: Eve Air Mobility Secures USD$88 million from BNDES to Finance eVTOL Manufacturing; Brazil's National Development Bank approved the financing to support the development of Eve's manufacturing facility in Brazil.
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility has secured an $88 million loan from Brazil's National Development Bank (BNDES) to finance its electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft production facility in Taubate, Sao Paulo. This financing, under the BNDES Mais Inovacao program, underscores BNDES's commitment to supporting innovative projects and Eve's efforts in decarbonization and urban air mobility. This new agreement strengthens Eve's financial position and supports its plans to expand production capacity for its eVTOL aircraft, which has a substantial backlog of orders.

feed.title: Embraer's Eve taps former Rolls-Royce executive as chief commercial officer
feed.summary: Eve Air Mobility, controlled by Embraer, has appointed Megha Bhatia, a former Rolls-Royce executive, as its new chief commercial officer. This strategic move comes as Eve continues to develop its electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft, aiming for certification and service entry in 2026 with nearly 3,000 potential orders already secured. Bhatia will oversee global sales, market intelligence, and government relations, leveraging her extensive experience in the aviation industry.

feed.title: Eve Holding, Inc. reports second quarter 2024 earnings results
feed.summary: Eve Holding, Inc. reported a net loss of $36.4 million in Q2 2024, an increase from $31.4 million in Q2 2023, primarily due to higher research and development expenses. The company's cash flow was impacted by increased R&D for its eVTOL aircraft, partially offset by a decrease in SG&A and a gain from derivatives. Subsequent to the quarter, Eve secured $95.6 million in new equity financing to strengthen its balance sheet and support future operations.

feed.title: Investment in Eve Air Mobility, a manufacturer of electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft, for strategic partnership through Nidec’s subsidiary
feed.summary: Nidec Corporation announced a $20 million minority equity investment in Eve Air Mobility, an eVTOL aircraft manufacturer, through its subsidiary Nidec Motor Corporation. This strategic partnership aims to provide electric propulsion systems for Eve's aircraft and expand Nidec's presence in the broader aviation market, including infrastructure for electrified aircraft. The investment reinforces Nidec's commitment to urban air mobility and leverages its expertise in motor technology.

feed.title: Eve Holding: Stronger Outlook Despite Weak Performance (NYSE:EVEX)
feed.summary: Eve Holding's stock has declined despite progress in eVTOL development and increased order backlog, yet the company maintains the largest market share in a potentially trillion-dollar industry. Strong support from Embraer and a simpler certification path through ANAC contribute to a positive outlook. Investors can anticipate several pivotal catalysts in the next 12-18 months, including prototype completion and test campaigns.

feed.title: Eve Holding, Inc. Reports Fourth Quarter and FY2023 Results
feed.summary: Eve Holding, Inc. reported its fourth quarter and fiscal year 2023 earnings results, highlighting significant milestones in its eVTOL development, including defining the final architecture, initiating full-scale prototype production, and advancing the certification process. The company incurred a net loss of $39.3 million in Q4 2023 and $127.7 million for the full year, primarily due to increased Research & Development expenses, and maintained a total liquidity of over $300 million to fund operations through 2025. Eve also detailed its progress in securing non-binding Letters of Intent for 2,850 aircraft and developing Urban Air Traffic Management software, demonstrating its comprehensive approach to the Urban Air Mobility ecosystem.

feed.title: Technology Companies Introduce Electric Flying Taxi Projects in Brazil
feed.summary: Technology companies are introducing electric flying taxi projects in Brazil, with Eve Holding Inc. planning to launch a commercial service by 2026. Eve has accumulated over 2,770 orders for its eVTOL vehicles and secured $92.5 million in credit from Brazil's National Development Bank. However, the projects face challenges regarding official certification and regulation for this new sector.

feed.title: Eve Holding Tests Electric Flying Vehicle in Wind Tunnel, Ready for Production in 2026
feed.summary: Eve Holding Inc., a Brazilian electric aircraft company controlled by Embraer, has successfully completed wind tunnel testing for its electric vertical take-off and landing vehicle (eVTOL), also known as a flying taxi. This crucial step moves them closer to commercial operations by 2026, with plans to select key equipment suppliers and begin building their first full-size prototype this year. The company boasts a backlog of nearly 2,800 orders and is supported by investors like United Airlines and Rolls-Royce.

feed.title: United to Invest $15 Million in Flying-Taxi Maker Backed by Embraer
feed.summary: United Airlines is investing $15 million in Eve Air Mobility, a flying-taxi maker backed by Embraer, and has made a conditional agreement to purchase 200 of Eve's four-passenger electric aircraft, with options for an additional 200. This is United's second significant investment in the nascent flying-taxi market, as it anticipates a booming demand for such services as early as 2026. The airline expects to need hundreds of these vertical takeoff and landing aircraft to cater to future market needs.

feed.title: United Invests Another $15 Million in Electric Flying Taxi Market with Eve
feed.summary: United Airlines has announced a $15 million investment in Eve Air Mobility, along with a conditional purchase agreement for 200 four-seat electric aircraft and an option for 200 more, with deliveries expected as early as 2026. This move further solidifies United's commitment to urban air mobility (UAM) and its goal of achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. Eve's eVTOL aircraft design offers a sustainable, quieter, and efficient transportation solution for urban commutes, leveraging Embraer's aerospace expertise.

feed.title: EVE Showcases its eVTOL Cabin for the 1st Time at the Farnbo
feed.summary: Eve Holding, Inc. (NYSE: EVEX; EVEXW) unveiled its first full-sized eVTOL cabin mock-up at the Farnborough Airshow, emphasizing a human-centered design approach. The company also presented its latest vehicle configuration, featuring a conventional wing and tail with eight fixed rotors for vertical take-off and landing. Eve aims for its eVTOL to enter service in 2026, offering environmentally friendly flights at a lower cost to foster the Urban Air Mobility market.
